DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim was to evaluate the relief of chest pain during the first 30 minutes among patients who received metoprolol alone as compared with metoprolol plus morphine
DOC.brief_title: Pain Relief of Metoprolol Versus Metoprolol Plus Morphine in Acute Chest Pain
DOC.criteria: Acute chest pain ECGsigns indicating myocardial ischemia Heart rate < 60 beats/min Systolic blood pressure < 110 mmHg High degree AVblock Signs of obstructive pulmonary disease Signs of pulmonary oedema Unwillingness Participation in other studies Long delay between arrival of ambulance and randomisation
